New Records: Zach Neto became the first Angels infielder with a 20-homer, 20-steal season
Key Match Events: Zach Neto hit a two-run home run in the fifth inning
Jack Kochanowicz pitched six scoreless innings
Detroit had runners on the corners with one out in the sixth inning but got a double play
Mike Stefanic hit an infield single off Tigers reliever Joey Wentz
Tigers reliever Will Vest replaced Wentz for the eighth inning
Pre-Game Insights: The Angels had lost 12 of 14 and were 1-8 going into the last game of their trip
Detroit, which had won six straight, left 10 runners on base
Tigers manager A.J. Hinch said the team had opportunities but couldn't string at-bats together
Post-Match Reflections: Angels manager Ron Washington praised Jack Kochanowicz's performance and Zach Neto's clutch hit
Miscellaneous Highlights: The Angels called up right-hander Caden Dana, their top prospect, and he would make his debut Sunday against the Mariners
The game was followed by a three-game series with the Seattle Mariners
